I have observed that there are three teachings in China. Since the time of Fu Xi painted the eight trigrams,
the Confucian teaching began from here.
Since Laozi wrote the Daodejing,
the Daoist teaching began from here.
Since Emperor Ming of the Han Dynasty dreamed of the golden man,
the Buddhist teaching began from here.
This is the sequence of the three teachings in China.
Generally speaking, Confucianism establishes teaching based on righteousness,
Daoism establishes teaching based on reverence,
and Buddhism establishes teaching based on greatness.
Observing their fondness for life and aversion to killing,
they are the same in benevolence.
Regarding others as oneself, they are the same in impartiality.
Investigating anger, restraining desires, forbidding wrongdoing, and preventing offenses,
they are the same in cultivation.
Thunder and lightning are heard by many, but the sun and moon are blind to the multitude,
they are the same in moral influence.
From their rough traces,
the principles of the world do not go beyond
the two paths of good and evil.
The intention of the three teachings is nothing more than wanting people to return to goodness.
Therefore, Emperor Xiaozong wrote the Original Way Debate, saying:
Use Buddhism to govern the mind.
Use Daoism to govern the body.
Use Confucianism to govern the world.
Truly understand that the mind, the body, and the world
cannot be left ungoverned in any way.
Then how can the three teachings be left unestablished in any way?
Wuzhenzi wrote the Treatise on Protecting the Dharma, saying:
Confucianism treats the skin.
Daoism treats the blood vessels.
Buddhism treats the bones and marrow.
Truly understand that the skin, the blood vessels, and the bones and marrow
cannot be left untreated in any way.
In this way, how can the three teachings be left unpracticed in any way?
Confucianism is in China.
It uses propriety and righteousness to correct people and clarify human relationships.
The four ways of ritual, music, punishment, and government are not contradictory.
Heaven, earth, and the myriad things are ranked and nurtured.
Its contribution to the world is great indeed.
Therefore, the First Emperor of Qin wanted to eliminate Confucianism.
But Confucianism could never be eliminated.
Daoism exists in China.
It makes people be pure and empty to guard themselves, and be humble and weak to hold themselves.
It washes away the habits of confusion and turmoil.
And returns to the realm of stillness, silence, and non-action.
Its contribution to the teachings of the world is utmost.
Therefore, Emperor Wu of Liang wanted to remove Daoism.
But Daoism could never be removed.
Buddhism exists in China.
It makes people abandon the flowery and pursue the real.
Turn away from falsehood and return to truth.
From vigorous practice, it leads to peaceful practice.
From benefiting oneself, it leads to benefiting others.
As a refuge for the people,
there is nothing that can surpass it.
Therefore, the three martial emperors wanted to destroy Buddhism.
But Buddhism could never be destroyed.
